content:
Continuing the discussion from #23925 here.

Currently in dark theme, the "Discard" text in the button is hard to read and white background is added while hovering over the button. Sharing a GIF showing the behvior -
save-discard-dark.gif

We discussed in the PR, that the text can be made light and we can possibly remove the hover behavior too. Sharing the screenshot below with the text color same as it is used for rest of the text in the page.
save-discard-dark-changes.png

Would love to know if there are more ideas we would want to try.

(Also, if anyone is trying it in dev server, the save-button background is not correct in dark theme and is fixed in #23925 and screenshots and GIF shared above are after fixing the save-button background)
I think it's good to have a hover behavior, but it can be much more subtle. @Vlad Korobov do you have a suggestion?

Tried adding some hover behavior with change in text and border color -

save-discard-dark-hover.gif

Sorry I don't know what to say here. Pick any simplest approach and change a background. Right now I see the icon blinks on hover which is not good. I guess I should start creating new UI for settings
I can see that icon blinks in light theme too. Will investigate the cause of it.
Looks reasonable to me if we can fix the blinking. Thanks!
